products.title: Make Z Guard Great Again by Craig Jones
products.body_html:
Craig Jones is one of the most popular and in-demand instructors in the game today, with an exciting style that has secured him many elite wins and a teaching method that is detailed and thorough

  • Craig shows you the most common passes to z guard, then how to counter each one in turn so you can establish your guard for long periods of time.
  • Set up a strong and sticky half guard game that can help you move from submissions to sweeps as you defend against strong top players.
  • The Z guard is a dynamic half guard game that lets Craig set up triangles, kimura, arm locks, leg locks, and more - each one broken down in step-by-step detail for grapplers of all levels.
  • Lean how to transition in and out of Z guard so that you can make this a common and dependable part of your style, just like Craig does at the elite level of competition grappling.

Master The Knee Shield Half Guard With No-Gi Grappling’s Favorite Runner-Up Craig Jones, As This ADCC Medalist Shows You His System For Developing A Dynamic & Modern Z Guard

Check Out The Trailer!

What Will You Learn?

Are you ready to take your no-gi half guard to the next level? ADCC Runner-Up & submission grappling bon vivant Craig Jones is here with BJJ Fanatics to show you everything you need to know to develop a Z guard that you can rely on, with attacks, defense, transitions, and more that he has made a signature part of his game against elite competition. Learn some of the same secrets he’s used in his successful career on this six-volume series as Craig takes you through his system of attack for his favorite guard.

The Z guard/knee shield offers a lot of diverse pathways for offense in submission grappling, with options for armbars, kimuras, choi bars, triangles and more. Craig shows some of his favorite and most effective entries into leg locks, including how he gets into cross ashi, backside heel hooks, and outside heel hooks for some of his most common fight-finishing techniques. Turn your half guard into a minefield of submission threats using Craig’s help.

Develop a real Z guard that can withstand pressure and attack as Craig explains all of the most common passes that you’ll see against the knee shield, and then exactly how to counter them so you can stay in good position. It’s not enough to get a good guard, you have to keep it - so learning these maintenance tips can make a huge difference in your game with counters to weave passes, pressure, HQ passing, and more.

Across six full volumes, Craig delivers a winning system that creates one unified plan of attack from his best guard. The Z guard is one of the most effective and modern positions in no-gi, because of the connection and diversity of offense, and now it can be yours on this series from one of the best in the game.

 

So, What Exactly Do You Get?

PART 1

  • INTRODUCTION
  • Z-GUARD POSITIONING
  • Z-GUARD RETENTION
  • DEVELOPING A DYNAMIC Z-GUARD

    • PART 2

    PASSING Z-GUARD

  • INTRO TO PASSING SECTION
  • HIP SWITCH PASS
  • HIP SWITCH COUNTER
  • HEADQUARTERS
  • DEALING W/ HEADQUARTERS
  • DR. LACHLAN GILE (PHD/M.D./SHE/HER/HERS) PASS
  • TACKLE SWITCH COUNTER
  • THE PROBLEM OF THE WEAVE PASS
  • WEAVE PASS COUNTERS
  • JASON RAU: THAT UNASSUMING BASTARD
  • DEALING WITH THE RAU
  • KIT DALE PASS
  • COUNTERING $&*^ DALE

    • PART 3

    ATTACKING FROM Z-GUARD

  • KIMURA USE YOUR THUMBS
  • KIMURA TO ARMBAR
  • CREATING MOVEMENT
  • BELLY DOWN VARIATION
  • ACHILLES TRIANGLE
  • ACHILLES TO FRONT TRIANGLE
  • YOKO ONO TRIANGLE

    • PART 4

  • CHOI BAR SET UP/GRIPPING SEQUENCE
  • CHOI BAR
  • BEST WAY TO DEVELOP AN ARMBAR
  • CHOI BAR TRIANGLE
  • BAITING THE TRIANGLE
  • OMOPLATA
  • OMOPLATA TO ARMBAR
  • OMOPLATA TO THE LEGS

    • PART 5

  • K GUARD BACK TAKE
  • SINGLE LEG X ENTRY
  • SWEEP FIRST SUBMIT SECONDS
  • THE FLAGPOLE GRIP
  • BASIC REAP
  • SOME FLASHLY BULL$&@*
  • CRAB TO CROSS ASHI (THE FUN TYPE OF CRAB)
  • FLOATING Z
  • STANDING ASHI OVERVIEW

    • PART 6

    TRANSITIONING FROM Z-GUARD

  • KNEELING OPPONENT
  • STANDING OPPONENT
  • THE 3 KEY BATTLES
  • GOING THROUGH THE WHIZZER
  • GOING WITH THE WHIZZER
  • WHIZZER PLAN B
  • REINFORCED HALF GUARD

    • $197

products.title: Power Bottom by Craig Jones
products.body_html:
Learn the B-Team bottom game, including how to use wrestling concepts, turtling, heisting, and more for a comprehensive system

  • Force your opponents into a new style of grappling with stand ups, 4 point positions, turtle position, and more used to create action
  • See new positions that can revolutionize your bottom game, including the reverse Z guard and the false half guard
  • Craig is one of the most popular instructors in the world, with ADCC Medals & sustained elite competition success
  • Attack throws and submissions, with options for reversals, leg locks, back takes, and more across 6-volumes

Combine Wrestling And Jiu-Jitsu With Stand Ups, Heists, Submissions, and More - Develop A Dangerous, Effective Bottom Game With These No-Gi Guard Concepts & Systems From Australian Grappling Superstar Craig Jones!

 

Check Out The Trailer!

What Will You Learn?

Join Aussie grappling star Craig Jones as he teaches you how to fight from bottom using the most modern and successful style of guard play that combines submissions, wrestling, and more into a dangerous & effective system for attack. This 6-part series has a full breakdown of the no-gi guard that will help you score more and frustrate opponents with this new approach to the bottom position.

The B-Team bottom game is based around a few simple concepts that Craig breaks down for you, helping you understand the philosophies that his team uses to train for elite competition success. With those lessons, go through Craig’s ranges of guard and see how you can best set up double legs, single legs, ashi entries, and more using his style of forcing action with threats of standing up.

As no-gi grappling continues to evolve, merge your grappling with important wrestling lessons and positions that can start helping you win on the mat. Combine these lessons with rear body locks, turtle position, 4-points, and more - Craig explains each position in full detail so you can confidently work from bottom and give yourself the highest chance of success.

With systems for the long range open guard, short range open guard, half guard, and innovative systems for Craig’s reverse Z guard and false half guard, there is a ton of knowledge being shared here that can transform your game. Start learning from one of grappling’s most effective bottom players with Craig’s modern take on classic positions.

So, What Exactly Do You Get?

PART 1

  • INTRODUCTION

    • MEXICAN CONCEPTS & PRINCIPLES

  • IF YOU CAN GET UP, GET UP
  • IF YOU CAN SHOOT, SHOOT
  • IF YOU CAN TURTLE, TURTLE
